website_summaries.verdict: With excellent photo and video quality and a deep feature set, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ1000 is the perfect mix if you want dSLR-like controls and better than point-and-shoot performance with the convenience of a single fixed lens.
pros: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ1000 produces excellent photos and video
it has an expansive feature set to satisfy snapshooters and enthusiasts
it offers a lot of direct access to important settings and has a fantastic electronic viewfinder
cons: Its maximum f/2.8 aperture is only available at its widest focal length
The plastic body and large lens makes it feel a bit off-balance
Controls and shooting options might be intimidating for some

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera
customer_reviews.text: A photographer friend remarked on that sunrise photo: > Wow, very nice. What impresses me beyond the aesthetics is that the > sensor has enough sensitivity and dynamic range to capture the birds > without any blur against a fairly dark background and with the sun > in saturation - and that the software balanced all this so well. The size of the camera is a bit large for my hands, but not an issue. If it were lighter in weight that would be nice too. These minuses are tiny in comparison to how amazing the camera is at delivering feelings of delight at some of the images that I am able to capture with it.
customer_reviews.author: steve-ft-laud

customer_reviews.title: After having this camera for seven months the internal workings ...
customer_reviews.text: After having this camera for seven months the internal workings of the camera lens was flopping around, this is not acceptable. I wish I could add a picture showing the internal Lens failure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Bridge Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am using this camera for those fast action shots when my granddaughters play soccer and run track. Clear images and great colour! I am also impressed with the macro shots!
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Awful  repair service
customer_reviews.text: This camera has many fine fetchers, BUT save yourself the headache of having to deal with the Panasonic Texas repair service center. I will never buy anything consumer electronics from Panasonic. This center has; unabashedly lied. Its basic trick is for you to send in your devise; then to tell you it it costs more to fix than it is worth (even it it is the most simplest manufacturing error) ; then get you to buy someone else's old equipment. In the mean time you will have sent your equipment back and forth to TX.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: WOW, what a surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I have GAS, lol. I have three Nikon DLSR bodies and 11 lenses. I lacked a do it all long zoom though and was thinking of the Tamron 18-400mm zoom. I don't know how I missed the Panasonic FZ1000 camera all these years. I took a chance and ordered it since it covers the same range as the Tamron lens. It surpassed my expectations! It focuses faster than my Nikons do, is lighter than any of my bodies with the Tamron would be, has a faster frame rate, will do video in 4K and was about $150 cheaper than the Tamron 18-400 lens! Excellent camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Amazing features. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! This is my first camera of this type. Bought it for work. Features galore on this camera. Great images. Relatively shallow learning curve. Bought Rode mic to complete the package. Would buy again without hesitation. Would recommend for casual user that is looking for more professional features than point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for performance.
customer_reviews.text: At this price point you can get some great cameras. This is not one of them. I've had both the FZ300 and FZ1000 before this, and it suffers from the same problems: 1) Very sluggish to come to life. 2) Sluggish Zoom ring and top dial. 3) Picture Quality is poor: fuzzy focus, overexposed. 4) IBIS makes a lot of noise, becomes annoying. This is going back where it came from. You can do much better with other brands at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Szava-kovats

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Having been the owner of a Nikon p900 superzoom I was disappointed with the image quality with the small sensor. With the one-inch sensor on this camera and up to 400 millimeter lens you still have the digital Zoom capability, maybe not as far-reaching as the Nikon but gives you a well extended super zoom with better image quality in this camera. I find the switches and the sound but especially the quickness of the zoom to auto focus is what makes this a great bridge camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still new to the fz1000, but love it so far. I wasn't sure as first about the material quality because it's deceptively light for its size. But I think it's more a plus than a concern. The picture quality has been good so far, though I've mostly worked with auto settings as I'm still familiarizing myself with the camera. The only downside I've seen is the battery life is a bit lacking for someone like me who takes quite a lot of shots on amateur photo trips. But I got a couple of spares, and it's not a big deal to swap them out. Really impressed so far, and I'm excited to dive even deeper into its features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bridge camera clear crisp images fast auto focus.
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before I bought this bridge camera. I wanted outstanding quality in a bridge for the few times I don't want to take all my gear. This camera definitely lived up to the challenge. The larger sensor really helps with rhe auto focus. Crisp vibrant beautiful images. Even in low light the camera was way above average in it's performance good feel in the hands. I even let my wife shoot in auto mode still great images.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Champagne

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: What is there not to like? I thought about getting the Canon 60HS but due to its small sensor it doesn't do very well in low light. The FZ1000 with its 1" sensor does fine. And the Intelligent Auto modes mean I can take great pictures and videos even though I am a newbie and don't really know what I am doing. LOL! The only thing the Canon 60HS or 70HS have over the FZ1000 is its optical zoom length. The FZ1000 blows away the Canons in every other respect (no contest).
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Available for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A large camera but absolutely the best available for the price. A few years old now, thus the bargain price, but you will not be disappointed. Mind-boggling configurability for those who want total control. or simply put the device in auto for those who want professional results unavailable with the typical point and shoot camera. Replace all the weight and cumbersome lenses needed for a DSLR system. This camera's lens quality and zoom length (25-400 mm 35mm equivalent) can match systems many times the cost of the DMC-FZ1000.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!  If you're looking for the highest image quality for the money make this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my purchase from Amazon Warehouse. The pictures and footage taken from the camera's 1 inch sensor at 1080P@60FPS, and 4K@30FPS are no less than superb. When considering the FZ1000's excellent optics and microphone input there's no other sub $400 option than the DMC-FZ1000. Should external recording be required the HDMI out is compatible with industry standard recorders. There are a few quirks effecting smooth zooming , audible auto focus noise, and mechanical rattle when turned OFF. It should be noted that when recording with the camera's internal microphone the auto focusing noise will be noticeable. Did a bit of research and found similar complaints since camera introduction.
customer_reviews.author: J Hess

customer_reviews.title: Thank You PANASONIC LUMIX LEICA!!!
customer_reviews.text: A true triple threat. Very nice ergonomic & sturdy PANASONIC Body. LUMIX has packed every feature most amateurs will ever need. This includes both stills & 4K video. The cream on top is this wonderful LEICA lens. 25-400mm. F2.8-4.0. 62mm lens. Serious challenger to all in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Archie K. McMath

customer_reviews.title: Safari with Lumix
customer_reviews.text: We took this on Safari at the Mala Mala game reserve. This turned out to be on of my better decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Yoga For Golfers (Consignment)

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have had!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of cameras in my day, and this is hands down. The big sensor really helps. It's SLR quality without having to carry around heavy lenses. I use it at the Dog Park all the time, and get clear action shots with fast shutter speeds with no blur, even when lighting isn't the best. I've had it for a year and a half now, and have taken over 40,000 pictures with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT camera! This has everything I want. I've read all the reviews before purchasing this camera and I am not disappointed. Pictures are super clear. Macro zoom is my absolute friend and that's one of the main reasons I had for buying it. Camera is easy to use and user friendly menu - even for me! Camera is big, not so light but has a solid firm grip to it. Pricey but I believe worth it. The only drawback I can see so far is like the manufacturer states; you will lose some focus with the higher zoom levels, as to be expected. Software is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carathren A. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for recording 4K video
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and this camera was always in the top of the list. Several sites rank it as number one. I had Panasonic FZ80 and needed a little bit better camera to record 4K video. I have recorded several videos and was really impressed by the quality. I have a number of action cameras and this camera surpasses them.
customer_reviews.author: tr2v3l3r

customer_reviews.title: Pro photog sez, this is a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've always shot Nikon pro-level cameras in my work. But when I decided to downsize for a trip, I bought the Lumix FZ1000. I liked that it was virtually identical to the much more expensive Leica model and had the same Leica glass. I was super surprised at the quality of images. Focus is fast, the zoom range is nothing short of amazing, and the auto-focus images are tack sharp. Neat! This has largely replaced my Nikons as my go-to camera for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin F. Ehringer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Nikon & Canon, but recently in testing a new Nikon, I was just not pleased with them anymore. So I read lots of reviews on the Panasonic, watched lots of videos, and decided to go with the FZ1000 4k. Wow! What a nice camera and it did everything they said it will do! I just got it yesterday so I haven't played around with every feature, macro being the feature that piques my interest. All in all, this is a great camera for the price and it is packed with features! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Panasonic Lumex
customer_reviews.text: this is my 4th panasonic lumex and they just get better and better and was already a much better camera than nikon or kodak. not too difficult for beginners but has some features that are good for more professional use. i take alot of sport photos and my shots are frequently better than anyone elses. i truly wish more stores would carry this product and not focus only on the 2 major camera brands. they are doing their customers a disservice by not giving the consumer more to choose from
customer_reviews.author: truthsayer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing camera for the money!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to carry extra lenses, this very advanced Bridge Camera could be all that you will need. With it's Fast F/2.8-4.0 lens and Bright viewfinder, it performs like a much more expensive camera. The sensor is large enough that you can actually make large Prints of your images. Version II is out now, but I don't feel the need to upgrade. This Leica lens is very sharp!
customer_reviews.author: CameraGuy6781

customer_reviews.title: Love/hate relationship with this camera - hate finally won out.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this camera a couple of times. Not new ones, but used from Amazon warehouse. I start out thinking it so cool. But after about the 5th shoot of the moon, the excitement died out. The photos are good, but not great. Sort of soft. The video, especially the 4k is a pain in the nose to try to use. I honestly have to say my Sony wx350 makes a lot better shots, even in low light. So, I don't think there will be a 3rd order, no matter how tempting the price is.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: I shoot in RAW.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible. Shoots in RAW It’s a crime to be so good at this price Contrary to your beliefs, this camera is at real as it can be. I’ve shot weddings, parties, models & concerts with it. So good that I buying my second shooter one to use. No touch screen but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Stallworth Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Bad a$$ camera, got it on sale $450 but it’s worth the $800 price tag. I thought that’s a lot of $$$ fir a camera, but after using it man it rocks. Makes you look like you know how to take pictures. Unless you own high dollar cameras and expect this performance, it is the best camera I have owned. Very clear pics and great video even in low light. Just awesome!
customer_reviews.author: J Pike

customer_reviews.title: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ1000 4K Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Pictures were not sharp enough, very poor quality in low light. I believe after using ~$500 Nikon Coolpix P900 this did not impress me. I returned it. Got the Lumix FZ2500 which is more expensive than this one but it was worth spending the extra bucks. I have read about some of the quality control issues with Panasonic cameras when 2 similar cameras will have different results with same configuration. I think with the camera that I got, this could be the issue. I was not at all expecting such poor quality results in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Mr ZAKS

customer_reviews.title: So far to good, still have a lot to learn but this ...
customer_reviews.text: So far to good, still have a lot to learn but this thing takes some very good pictures once you learn some of the basics. Extracting photos from the 4k video is very nice. Zoomed up to the moon tonight and got this (handheld), not too bad if I say so...
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Whirrring sound is undesirable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera only a few months. I was looking for a good "travel" camera. One thing that is seriously annoying is the loud machine sound it makes. Your movies will have a whirring sound that is similar to the sound of a hard drive in your laptop . . . checked the manual and unfortunately this is "normal". Otherwise picture quality is good. Movies, less so given the noise and limited filming time, limited battery life. Bottom line, download & read the manual before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bananakeet

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! I found it here, from this vendor, $100 cheaper than anywhere else. It was brand new, original boxing. We use it for photographing surfing. The range and quality of the pictures are fantastic. I do recommend buying a top notch SD card.
customer_reviews.author: EV enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: By chance i purchased such a nice camera! I am as happy as a pig in the mud! :) for those wondering if it worth to pay extra to buy upgraded version, or the next higher model! Well i wouldnt! I dont like buying a car with 500mph speed and drive on 30mph speed limit road! If you get what i am trying to say! Most of us do not ever need all those extra specs that come with highest models and we just pay for what we never use! This camera has everything i feel i ever need for the next 10 years or even longer!
customer_reviews.author: Deev

customer_reviews.title: Great but one problem...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has done exactly what I wanted it to do; take quality pictures and videos. I am very satisfied with this product. However, there was one issue I came across. I don't know if it has been this way since I bought it, but once in a quiet room, I heard a humming sound coming from the camera. I'm not sure what it is, maybe the motor. The camera still works fine, but the sound makes me think something is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: The Critique

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I’m an avid amateur photographer and was looking to update my old Canon Rebel DSLR. I need something with really good image stabilization as my hands shake and this has been wonderful! It does great in a variety of lighting and consistently produces crisp, clear photos. There is a learning curve if you’re a beginner to figure out the settings, etc. Its definitely not a pocket point and shoot but it is a very nice performer for avid amateurs.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: FAIR FOR CHEAP CAMERA BUT HAS GOOD POINTS...
customer_reviews.text: STEEP LEARNING CURVE , HOWEVER IF LOTS OF USE THE FIRST THING THAT WENT WAS THE ZOOM LEVER SPRING THATS AROUND SHUTTER BUTTON BUT YOU CAN ZOOM WTH LENS COLLAR , THE TOGGLE SWITCH ALSO JAMS THEN TAKES WEEKS TO REPAIR ITSELF AFTER LEAVING DORMANT (DON'T WANT TO FORCE IT) SO I MOVED ALL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS (WHITE BALANCE , SHUTTER SPEED APERTURE , VIDEO RESOLUTION ETC. TO SHORT CUT BUTTON BELOW FOCUS LOCK .. HAS INHERANT FOCUS PROBLEMS AND IS NOT USEFULL FOR ACTION UNLESS YOU ARE SEASONED VETERAN .
customer_reviews.author: Doris W

customer_reviews.title: Good "all-in-one" package
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my wife's Samsung mirrorless DSLR type camera. The image quality is better and this one has remote operation from her phone, now our DIY family pictures are lots easier. I'm not a camera buff, but this has exceeded my expectations, and has more functions than were ever likely to use.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Older camera, Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: I used Nikon cameras until now. First Panasonic I have ever own. I LOVE IT!. It takes amazing pictures. If you use the Auto feature its great, if you venture out to scene modes or A,S, or even M modes the pictures are clear, sharp and beautiful. Really sharp clear pictures on Zoom as well.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Good compliment to fz300
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fz300 a couple of years ago, but I wanted a larger sensor. The fz1000 has a bit larger one than the fz300 and they compliment each other well. If I ever am able to afford an even larger, 4/3rd sensor, in a bridge camera configuration, I upgrade again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure that there is a better value on the market
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very impressed by the feature set, image quality, and price. It seems fairly durable even though there is a lot of plastic. The feature set is impressive and the 4K video is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Takes amazing pictures. There was a learning curve for me, but I bought the manual and brought myself up to speed. For the price point, this was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: adventurebabbler

customer_reviews.title: 4K video!  What not to like?
customer_reviews.text: There's been alot written about this camera, so there's not much to say. There were many times when lugging the Canon DSLR around was a bit much. To get the zoom coverage that this camera gives would involve carrying alot of bulk and alot of weight. There are times when I might need an f1.4 lens with very shallow depth of field, and there are times when there are situations that a DSLR is preferable. But NONE of my DSLR's shoots video at 4K and none of them are as light and small as this one. Pictures that in the past would not have been taken or done very badly with a smartphone are now taken. And they look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCapsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good all-rounder
customer_reviews.text: Good compromise camera (replacing Pentax DSLR). Not totally convinced by the auto focus, but that might just be me. I use it for professional purposes and it does the job well. Haven't used the video much so can't really comment on that for now. The FZ1000 is an older model but still very good value.
customer_reviews.author: The Big F

customer_reviews.title: Very good for travel
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional. I have had some good cameras before. This one is very nice from a traveler point of view. It is not small compared to a compact camera but smaller than the average DSLR. Very good zoom with stabilization. Transferring pictures from the camera to my phone is a nice function but takes time to setup every time. Doesn't do it automatically. 1st world problems... I really like the LCD screen and it rotates out and around for selfies. Overall I am very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.author: Dave C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: High quality photos for pros and amateurs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bridge camera. High quality images, like a pro, even for an amateur. Many features for both the pro and amateur, as there are many features that suit either. Zoom images are very high quality. Rapid fire photo shoots are great for special moments. Just used it for graduation and got dozens of sharp photos of every moment of the subject receiving diploma. Best graduation photo series we ever had. In low light it takes very clear photos. Great value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Older design, good quality pics, video is pretty outdated and ultimately returned
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, as large as a DSLR. Good quality pics especially using zoom function at 400m. Video was erratic with visible delays after recording. There are better models but for the $$ still a viable option. I did end up returning as it was just too big and video disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TX Hills

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: For two months I scoured the internet trying to find the best camera for me. I looked at all of the given specs, watched hours of videos, and looked at photos others had taken with said cameras. The fz1000 was the best purchase I've made in a long time. It's a little complicated but I'm quickly learning it's process. My first star photos were fabulous. If you are in the same shoes of looking at cameras, this is it. Adorama shipped it promptly, and I received it a day early, in perfect condition. Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: Mwar006

customer_reviews.title: I’m very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Took a little playing with this camera but once I figured it out it’s an awesome camera - I’m sure I still don’t know all there is to know about this camera but it takes beautiful pictures Comfortable to hold and shoot pictures a little on the heavy side but I like that in a camera
customer_reviews.author: Joanb714

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper for Sure!
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. Sharp, fast versatile. I shoot mainly RAW. Some of the "features" of the camera only work in jpg format, and possibly the FZ2000, when ever its released, might extend these features to cover RAW shooting. It does use up the battery so a couple of additional batts are a must. If your a tripod shooter you will find the battery door is covered by the tripod base. Changing battery requires removing the camera from the tripod. But to sum up, this is a great camera, a keeper for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Ken

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Long Zoom Camera
customer_reviews.text: Unbelieveable quality pictures! I've tried many other super zoom cameras include other Panasonic enthusiast models like the FZ300. The big difference is the 1' sensor -- it makes a huge difference. And combined with excellent lens and quite amazing stabilization technology, I can see how this FZ1000 continues to be rated as one of the BEST long zoom cameras.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Never missed a beat!
customer_reviews.text: What a phenomenal camera! I've been using it in a combination of situations for the past 9 months while travelling, it's worked as a video camera for panoramic vistas, worked as a fantastic camera for fabulous stills, timelapses, night long-exposures you name it! Lately been using it for filming castings for a tv production, behind the scenes interviews and product, catalogue and fashion photography! Such a versatile affordable camera!
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Product seemed flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lens hood that didn't want to stay in place. The screen in the rear folds out - I see no advantage other than it being broken easily. Returned for a full refund, no problems with the return.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Awald

customer_reviews.title: For one camera that does it all, this is it. Leave all the others home. It just won't fit in your pocket!
customer_reviews.text: It may take a few years to explore all the wonderful features of this capable camera. I like the heft and size, myriad buttons and knobs for customization, and especially love the quality of the pictures. It has an uncanny ability to take pictures on automatic that would leave my other cameras panting. It makes my 5K iMac really show its colors. The powerful zoom has very little distortion and focusing has never been so fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: HOANA

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: excellent camera replacing my Rebel. 8 months and not an single issue. Fantastic pictures. Easy to use with good features. Difficulty connecting to wi-fi and smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: FRANCIS RIDDLE

customer_reviews.title: excited
customer_reviews.text: love it and will love it. I'd considered a sony bridge camera, 200 more. This one offered the stabilization , low light and other features. The sony seems to have tons more features, but it complex. This one will combine photos. The complaint is that it's plastic versus sony metal.....but I've always taken great care of cameras. I don't see a problem. One issue is: literature and the handbook seem not translated well, but I use youtube videos to learn most stuff anyways. This is a full size camera and is heavy, and I like that. This is not your compact travel cam though. It's a real machine.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter Bee Dot Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Not usable as shipped.
customer_reviews.text: No memory chip shipped with the unit. A heads up would have saved me an embarrassing situation.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Kirchner

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera last year and am still wading through all it can do. Before I made the purchase I read just about every review there was then. The result is that this camera is my favorite and I use it far more than I have with my Canons DSLRs. It is beyond excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great all around camera to use from Macro, landscape/portrait, to long distance photography. Excellent power on time, low light/speed, and glass. I've used this for awhile now and have had no issues or cons to speak of. This is not touted as a replacement for a DSLR with interchangeable lenses. But I find myself reaching for this a lot over them. For the price its a very frugal and highly recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ1000
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific camera. Unfortunately, the third party shipper send a grey market item which had no USA warranty. I had to return it and bought one at our local camera store. Amazon was great about the return. This camera shoots as sharply as my Nikon D7100 with any of my top-end lenses. And I've reduced my camera bag weight from about 25 pounds to about 4 pounds. I highly recommend this camera -- but make sure you're getting one with a USA warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RWren

customer_reviews.title: I read the Amazon reviews and chose this camera, very happy that I did.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the best review I can give is to read the other reviews. I did a lot of research on cameras before buying this and quite a lot of it was reading reviews here on Amazon. Also check out the Cnet comparison tools to make sure this camera fits your needs. I have a Bachelor of Fine Arts in photography and lean heavily towards film but this guy was a great choice to take on my honeymoon, vacations, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the box solutions!
customer_reviews.text: I use Nikon DSLR, so transitioning in to this device with work, I was slightly hesitant. However, I enjoy the quality of the photos and easy interface. I am still figuring out some of the features and making easy adjustments. I wish the manual focus/zoom wasn't a switch for either or. Wish I had adjustments rings for both. Over all, out of the box, an easy camera for point and shoot and footage from this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R LSI

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough about it. So much happier with it than my Nikon D-5500. Fast, great range, really good images. And for video, well you just can't do better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CasTrav

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from my last camera
customer_reviews.text: So far zero complaints. Love the photo capture speed. The menu is easy to navigate through. Focus and zoom functions
customer_reviews.author: Throwerboy1911

customer_reviews.title: Don't be thinking it creates as good images as a full body
customer_reviews.text: It is a pro-sumer camera. Don't be thinking it creates as good images as a full body, full sensor dslr. The images will be of lower quality. But the much lower cost, small size, convenience of a huge range on the zoom, make it worth it. You get great value for what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great range!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this camera! I'm a professional photographer and find that I don't always want to carry my pro camera around for personal use or vacations, but want something better than my phone. I keep this Panasonic handy and love the range of the 25-400mm lens. Photos are great, even in intelligent auto mode. Controls are easy to use. And it is light enough that I'm happy to carry it. Highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: pleased
customer_reviews.text: i have the other good bridge camera as well, sony rx10, and both are excellent. this one focuses very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Lance E. PearsonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix FZ1000
customer_reviews.text: This camera is loaded with features. Picture quality is amazing. This camera let you shoot like a pro without being one.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera, but, very difficult to learn how. The documentation leaves a lot to be desired. I have a lot of experience with DSLR cameras, but this is so much different, I'm lost. If you want a great camera but don't have the time or brain needed, try something different.
customer_reviews.author: jeffinvegas

customer_reviews.title: Zoom focus is touchey and so is the touch screen.
customer_reviews.text: I had focus troublI had a problem with focus and zoom. I think it was from touchinges with bright objects. Otherwise I liked the camera o.k. I think this problem was due mostly from touching the screen while using the view finder..
customer_reviews.author: Jack Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this camera. I am absolutely a beginner in the photography world and definitely still learning but this camera makes it easy to produce high quality and professional looking photos.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Good all around camera
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with the sharp lens. Took some getting used to. Instruction book not real clear. If you want a camera for travel and to just have with you all the time, this is it! I do not know much of anything this camera cannot do once you get the hang of it. Somewhat complicated but you will get used to it and then it is a breeze to use.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "Bridge" Camera !
customer_reviews.text: Fully automatic Point and Shoot ... or ... Full manual control ... Excellent 1" sensor ... 20mp pics, 4K video ... Zeiss 25 to 400mm Zoom ... Excellent holdiday price ... What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with many features....
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Lumix FZ1000 for my back-up camera and have found out I'm using it more and more for my #1 camera. It's an amazing camera with many amazing features.
customer_reviews.author: Walter D. Vogt Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great company good camera for beginner or on the fly photographer
customer_reviews.text: I use a professional camera and purchased this after I saw several people using on a trip I was on. I would say it's not for me but for a beginner photographer it's great. Plus video is a plus. Read the directions before using and you will be happy. Easy to carry a good zoom (which I have to change my lenses).
customer_reviews.author: Lala van camp

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: As a true beginner into the world of photography, I love this camera. Light enough to carry, feels solid in my hands. The buttons are easy to use, and has alot of the bells & whistles of a much more expensive camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jojoeng

customer_reviews.title: An Upgrade from DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for 2 days but I already love it. But my Canon Speedlite 580EXII flash on it and it works great. Photos come out tack sharp. Just gave my Canon T2i (w/ Magic Lantern firmware) and assorted kit and prime lenses to my daughter. Could not be happier with this purchase. It is really cool to take a pic of something close up and then again all the way out and the depth of zoom blows people away.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera. Very impressive 4K
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Camera. Very impressive 4K. Slow motion smooth but not good quality - does not look like 1080p looks much more like 720p - probably due to it's low bit rate at 1080p. Also would have liked to see Auto ISO in 4K and built in ND filters. If your computer can't handle 4K - then downscale to 1080p - it looks very very good indeed. Good battery life. One battery will last a good long day. Fantastic focal range and great ability for bokeh with the full size sensor. Low light OK - but nothing outstanding for this day and age. For the money it's hard to beat... Best competitor would be the Sony Rx10ii.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothontop

customer_reviews.title: A Capable Camera Until Support is Needed
customer_reviews.text: The camera is a capable piece of equipment, yes it has flaws but is a good compromise. My issue is with Panasonic repair. They totally disrespected both my camera and me. It was returned filthy with fingerprints on the LENS and screen, mailed to an incorrect address instead of shipped via courier to my shipping address, NOT insured, and took 3 weeks to get to me from TX. I had to track it and was told they shipped it and had no responsibility for its safe return, or liability if it was lost. I suggest you purchase a Canon. Their support is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: CBS

customer_reviews.title: Panaxonic FZ-1000
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point and shoot camera. Be prepared that it is big more like an Digital Interchangeable Lens Camera. The options just do not quit, still learning all that this camera can do. This is a great all around camera unless you are looking for a small size camera
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Great Service from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this camera for a few days, but have used it doing two basketball games at my grandson's school..results were amazing, exposure spot on, action stills in perfect focus. There is a lot to learn with this camera, and I'm excited at all the possibilities this camera offers me, but it will take a little time to master. I reviewed several other digital cameras, but this camera has all the bells and whistles(more than I will probably use ) along with a great zoom, and a quality lens. Absolutely no buyer's remorse. If you are serious about improving you skills, then this is the camera to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Traded my Nikon flagship D500 for this much simpler “point and shoot.” It’s the most gratifying camera I’ve ever had — I can just grab it for a quick shot on a whim, or be as creative as I want with its many options. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with LUMIX!
customer_reviews.text: This is the #1 camera for an amateur photographer seeking a quality camera to capture nature scenes! This camera is great in any lighting and captures clear pictures regardless of weather. It’s not too heavy, but feels hefty enough to not be fragile when hiking. I am so happy with the camera and have no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a photographer with lots of cameras and lenses. I was happy to add this very dependable camera to my collection for when I don’t have room for all my gear. Takes great photos! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: His-angel

customer_reviews.title: BEST BRIDGE CAMERA EVER!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I'm lovin' it. It's not "all the way f2.8", but I'm still lovin' it. The mere fact that I don't have to deal with flash sync issues make this a 4.5 star camera. Usually, cameras with leaf shutters can cost $9K or much more (PhaseOne, Hasselblad, etc). I don't have to pay for expensive HSS flashes. You'd really be hard pressed to find a better bridge camera.
customer_reviews.author: EDDIE DID IT

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: The camera is too bulky and doesn't connect to the phone or laptop via Bluetooth smoothly. The app you have to download in order to transfer photos or videos is very outdated and difficult to work with. If you're looking for a vlogging camera, this is not the camera to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lula

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This camera offers more than most $2,000.00 cameras. Excellent picture quality, and includes tons of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Super camera
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's big, but for that zoom and the high quality photos, what can you expect? It handles beautifully, with a great grip and lightning fast and accurate focusing. I had the old Fujifilm S100fs, which I loved way back then, and this is a terrific update of that concept. Highly recommended if you can handle the bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for not being a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great if you want something with zoom with needing to change the lens. Stay away from the surplus because I tried to buy two and both wouldn't read my SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Growl

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for your daily photography, but it makes a slight wering noise now. It use to be silent. Still works perfectly for photos, but the videos have that quiet noise in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if you don't want to mess with multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera if you don't want to mess with multiple lenses but do want a powerful and flexible camera. I am very pleased with the quality of the pictures, built-in flash and video. I didn't want to get an SLR but did want something more useful than my iphone 6. This is a good choice in that case. The iphone camera gets better with every revision - however, can't compare to this camera - especially regarding the zoom and taking pictures in lower light scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding overall camera.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is outstanding and the zoom and stabilization work perfectly - even hand held at a long zoom...
customer_reviews.author: jmorgan103

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is about as close to a DSLR as I want to get. It had all the features I wanted. I just took it to shoot pictures at a special 3 day event. I shot 2,500 pictures in RAW. It did an excellent job shooting action pics in a difficult lighting situation. I shot pics towards the sun (no choice ) and they came out way better than I had hoped. The features I wanted were easy to get to no problems. Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've been hoping for a camera I'd like using as much as I did my FZ-30 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been hoping for a camera I'd like using as much as I did my FZ-30 and this is nearly there - and the images and features are superb. I'm particularly delighted to have built-in time-lapse and 5 exposure bracket settings. Very nearly my image of the perfect non-professional level camera
customer_reviews.author: TLB

customer_reviews.title: 9 or other aspects and now including them into the HD or UHD video I shot on the camera is a great advantage.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding camera, and I was shooting a Canon 7D. One of the unsung specialities is to allow you to shoot/save your jpegs as 16:9 or other aspects and now including them into the HD or UHD video I shot on the camera is a great advantage.. despite its size it is light and easy to use and I have found the buttons easy to reach and adjust.. The slow mo is smooth the UHD is sharp and works well with my editor.. I shoot lots of Nature and especially bird content and this is quick and responsive, especially the auto focus (and you have choices as to type you want or need that can be quickly changed.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but very bulky
customer_reviews.text: My older FZ150 really is better. More compact and greater zoom range. Fewer pixels but who uses the 21Meg that this one has.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Goat

customer_reviews.title: Finially found a bridge RAW file shooter
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking some time for a bridge camera that shoots RAW files. This fills the bill and is turning out excellent product. Great glass and very well engineered. Limited super zoom, but it shoots RAW. YEA! Larry
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Camera is heavy and big with too many tiny buttons
customer_reviews.text: Camera is heavy and big but has cheap plastic cavity covers, too many tiny buttons and no lens cover attachment. Picture quality was good but has much less zoom capability than my Canon SX50. I knew this but was hoping that the quality of the photos would be so good that I could crop and zoom after. Mistake. I am returning the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jane R

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the product. Easy ways to transfer photos to Google photos or phone albums. Easy to use too
customer_reviews.author: mohanakrishnan unnikrishnan

customer_reviews.title: I've owned many cameras- more and less expensive - this is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the second LUMIX I've had over the last five year and I've loved both. I've gotta say that the FZ1000 far FAR exceeds my my expectations. I took it around the world over the last two weeks and folks who see my pics ask "what kind of camera did you use?" When they pick it up they're amazed at just what it can do and the low level of light that it works perfectly with.
customer_reviews.author: Cokeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great for videos, photos, especially dark situations. I've never seen anything quite like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have owned and still my favorite camera of this type. Cannot speak to movies and 4K as I dont use it. Great low light photos and exceptiona speed on autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: RashRL

customer_reviews.title: Came without a battery! WTH?
customer_reviews.text: It showed up without a battery. Then my first call to customer service went mute. Then the second call couldn’t verify my account. 15 minutes later after going to a supervisor they solved the problem. Absurd! Is that what I pay for on my Prime account. So annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sapone

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. They have crammed a ton of cool features in this full sensor camera. A real value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Seattle

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ1000 4K Point and Shoot Camera, 16X LEICA DC Vario-ELMARIT F2.8-4.0 Lens, 21.1 Megapixels, 1 Inch High Sensitivity Sensor, DMC-FZ1000 (USA BLACK)
product_meta.description: Style:FZ1000The Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ1000 long zoom digital camera offers 4K video features and a Leica DC lens with 24x zoom and a bright F2. 8 aperture across the entire zoom range*. capture moments with superb 4K imaging performance in both video and exclusive 4K PHOTO**. The 4K PHOTO function can be used in three different modes, all allowing you to capture that perfect moment at a high burst Rate of 30 frames/photos per second. 4K video delivers a far more intense viewing experience that is four times larger*** than full HD, resulting in a much higher level of detail. Built into a splash proof/dustproof rugged camera body The Leica lens offers 5 axis hybrid optical image stabilization**** assures steady photos and videos, and a high sensitivity sensor with superb low light image quality. The LUMIX FZ1000 digital camera features a snug, hand-fitting grip and an intuitive level of operation. Control remotely by using the Panasonic image app on your Wi-Fi enabled smartphone or tablet. View The image, set the focus, or release the shutter from a distance, and then transfer images for sharing on social media. The creative panorama function allows you to create Dynamic panoramic photos by simply panning the camera. Panasonic depth-from-defocus (DFD) auto focus (AF) technology instantly calculates the distance between foreground and background and quickly brings the subject into focus in one fast, continuous movement. Disclaimer: *35 millimeter camera equivalent: 25-600 millimeter. **4K photo feature extracts megapixels photo out of a 4K video sequence up to QFHD: 3840 x 2160 Pixels, 30 fps, 100Mbit/s. ***4K photo feature extracts megapixels photo out of a 4K video sequence up to QFHD: 3840 x 2160 Pixels, 30 fps, 100Mbit/s. ****5-Axis hybrid O. I. S. Works in video recording except for 4K video recording.
feature_bullets: Big sensor quality: Large 1 inch 20.1MP MOS sensor for improved low light capture and large sensor background defocus effects
4K video & Photo: 4K 30P video with hybrid photography 8MP video frame grabs as photos
Leica DC lens: A bright and ultra sharp Leica DC lens 25 400 millimeter (16x) F2.8 4.0 and macro photography down to 3cm
Lens stabilizer: Hybrid O.I.S. (Optical image Stabilizer) + with 5 axis correction provides blur less, one handed video shooting
Integrated smartphone Wi Fi for remote imaging control via the Panasonic image app

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars505 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
